A Component_placement_restriction_assignment is the relationship between the area of an entire or a portion thereof and restrictions to placement of other components in that area due to an item in the design. The context of a Component_placement_restriction_assignment is the design of the assembly within which both the and associated components are identified.

ext_description.p: the minimum_mounting_clearance specifies the smallest for which the Component_placement_restriction_assignment is made. The minimum_mounting_clearance need not be specified for a particular Component_placement_restriction_assignment.
ext_description.example: An example of the minimum_mounting_clearance attribute is for a printed circuit assembly with through-hole components, where some packages are required to be mounted other than flush with the surface of the printed circuit board for purposes of cleaning or of thermal dissipation. The minimum_mounting_clearance is more frequently seen than the maximum_mounting_clearance. The usual default clearance dimension is zero, meaning that the component package is intended to be mounted flush with the printed circuit board. Packages that often require a minimum_mounting_clearance include radial capacitors and certain other devices where the leads protrude from the bottom of the package, and where the package is not usually intended to be bonded directly to the printed circuit board.

ext_description.p: the maximum_mounting_clearance specifies the largest for which the Component_placement_restriction_assignment is made. The maximum_mounting_clearance need not be specified for a particular Component_placement_restriction_assignment.
ext_description.example: An example of the maximum_mounting_clearance attribute is for a printed circuit assembly with through-hole components, where some packages are required to be mounted other than flush with the surface of the printed circuit board, for purposes of cleaning or of thermal dissipation. The maximum_mounting_clearance is less frequently seen than the minimum_mounting_clearance, but it is included for completeness. When a maximum dimension is required, it is often described by the maximum_positive_component_height attribute, which takes into consideration the maximum material condition of the package as well as the clearance from the printed circuit board.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the components_permitted specifies whether or not there is a restriction upon placement of components in an area for the Component_placement_restriction_assignment. The value of TRUE states that components are permitted; the value of FALSE states that components are not permitted to be placed in the defined area.
the requirement specifies the for the Component_placement_restriction_assignment.
the volume specifies the for the Component_placement_restriction_assignment. The volume is in the context of the assembly. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the area specifies the role of the for the Component_placement_restriction_assignment. The area is an area on an . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the maximum_positive_component_height specifies the largest in the positive direction from the , for which the Component_placement_restriction_assignment is made. The maximum_positive_component_height need not be specified for a particular Component_placement_restriction_assignment.
ext_description.example: An example of the maximum_positive_component_height attribute is a printed circuit assembly where the maximum component height in the positive direction relative to a datum is given. This dimension pertains to the fit of the printed circuit assembly in its next assembly. That dimension is the maximum_positive_component_height.

ext_description.p: the maximum_negative_component_height specifies the largest in the negative direction from that , for which the Component_placement_restriction_assignment is made. The maximum_negative_component_height need not be specified for a particular Component_placement_restriction_assignment.
ext_description.example: An example of the maximum_negative_component_height attribute is a printed circuit assembly with through-hole components, where the maximum lead protrusion dimension is given. That dimension is the maximum_negative_component_height. Another example of the maximum_negative_component_height attribute is a printed circuit assembly with surface mounted components on both sides. The maximum_negative_component_height attribute is the distance between the established datum and the maximum material condition of the vertical dimension of the highest surface mount component on the secondary side of the printed circuit assembly.

A Mounting_restriction_area is a type of . A Mounting_restriction_area is the region on an where mounting restrictions for components exist. The shape representing the Mounting_restriction_region shall have an origin that is congruent with the origin of the shape representing the . This congruency shall be accomplished using concepts equivalent to the Application objects Component_2d_position or Component_3d_position. The shape representing the Mounting_restriction_area is itself in the shape of the assembly, as is the shape of the . The congruency requirement is established so that an application interface can more unambiguously import the Mounting_restriction_area into a CAD layout tool. Mounting_restriction_area is part of a design requirement for an interconnect that is established in the assembly or assemblies in which the interconnect is used. The interconnect shall specify the assembly or assemblies it is designed to support by the assembly_design_requirement attribute of if the attribute is present.
the scope specifies the role of the for the Mounting_restriction_area. The element_shape is within the geometric model coordinate system.

the mounting_surface specifies the role of the for the Mounting_restriction_area. There shall be one surface in the role of mounting_surface for a Mounting_restriction_area. The type of surface is determined by the definition of the specified by mounting_surface. The mounting_surface conveys design intent to identify the component that implements the connectivity prescribed by the relevant member of .
The component associated with the mounting_surface shall be a component in the scope.

ext_description.p: A Placement_group is a group composed of that are associated with each other for this purpose by the , in order to meet some specific placement requirement. The placement is assigned through the object, and does not indicate the explicit geometric relationship of the Assembly_components to each other, only that they are all to be placed within an area.
ext_description.example: An example of a Placement_group is the collection of Assembly_components necessary to satisfy the functional requirement for a power supply.
An example of a Placement_group is the collection of Assembly_components necessary to satisfy the functional requirement for a digital signal processor.

An example of a Placement_group is the collection of Assembly_components with a case temperature greater than 55 degrees Centigrade. The associated area would be a rectangle all of whose inner points are within 6 cm of the cooling unit.
